intro: Trigonella balansae f. sartorii, commonly known as the Sartori's fenugreek, is a botanical variant of the fenugreek species. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice, similar to common fenugreek. The subspecies is distinguished by specific morphological traits that set it apart from other Trigonella species.
